results.title: An Interactive discovery tour of Victoria (PC)
results.brief_description: This program is produced under the auspices of Tourism Victoria and follows the campaign “You’ll love every piece of Victoria’. The main wonders of the State are presented in seven segments: Melbourne, Food and Wine, Shopping, Major Events, Arts and Culture, Regional Victoria, Location and Access. Aimed primarily at a foreign audience, the program is filled with maps, touring suggestions and good addresses as well as video interviews with Victorian identities. It is presented in 3 versions: Designed for PCs, this CD-ROM requires Windows 3.1 or above.

results.title: An Indecent obsession
results.brief_description: As World War II draws to a close, Ward X is a haven for a group of emotionally wounded men and their warm, sensitive nurse, Sister Langtry. However, peace can be shattered so easily and this is the story of a woman’s obsession to duty, and the obsession she unwittingly nurtures in the men she cares for - an obsession that is inescapable. Starring Wendy Hughes.

results.title: An Impression of London
results.creator_credit: Rayant Pictures, Anthony Gilkison and William Pollard
results.brief_description: The round-the-clock activities of a typical London day described by a young American girl in her diary. Arriving by air at dawn, she explores London - the Tower of London, a search for the site of Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre, feeding the pigeons in Trafalgar Square, a glimpse of the procession of the Household Cavalry at Hyde Park Corner, the streets, shops and parks, a visit to a riverside pub at dusk, dinner at a West End restaurant and a midnight cabaret.

results.title: An Illustration of basic film editing principles
results.brief_description: Leon Barsha of the American Cinema Editors has taken a sequence from the motion picture “Baby Face Nelson” to illustrate film editing techniques. Actors Mickey Rooney, Sir Cedric Hardwicke and Carolyn Jones are shown from our angle as on a stage. Then Leon Barsha shows how the same scene was heightened in mood and drama by editing with use of inserts - two shots, close-ups and extreme close-ups.
results.title_for_label: An Illustration of basic film editing principles

results.title: An Ideal husband
results.creator_credit: Ideal Films (GB), Fragile Films, ICON, Pathé Frères, Barnaby Thompson, Uri Fruchtmann, Bruce Davey and Oliver Parker
results.brief_description: Romantic comedy set in London during the late 1800’s inspired by Oscar Wilde’s play. Rupert Everett plays Arthur Goring, an upper class, womanising bachelor famed for his idleness and wit. His best friend Sir Robert Chiltern (Jeremy Northam) is a respected politician with a captivating and righteous wife (Cate Blanchett). Arthur’s loyalty and friendship is put to the test when the foundation of his friend’s idyllic marriage is threatened by the arrival of the scheming Mrs Cheveley (Julianne Moore) carrying secrets from Sir Robert’s past. Arthur finds himself caught up in a web of love, betrayal and deceit as he attempts to console his friends and protect their marriage. His actions inadvertently lead to changes in his own life and future. Also stars Minnie Driver and John Wood. Screenplay by Oliver Parker. Photography by David Johnson. Edited by Guy Bensley. Music composed by Charlie Mole.

results.title: An Eye for business
results.brief_description: Shows how ideas and design are converted into computer language and how the “light pen” has enabled the engineer or designer to communicate with a computer in his own terms-pictorially-by the technique of computer graphics.

results.title: An Experiment in towns
results.creator_credit: Rayant Pictures, Anthony Gilkison and John Reeve
results.brief_description: Shows the reasons why Britain has recently built fifteen towns - to give healthier working conditions, closer proximity to work, and enable “men to lunch in their own homes”. Explains how the planned towns are designed to allow safe play for children and creative leisure for adults. Shows the good design of individual homes.

results.title: An Expedition into a volcano
results.brief_description: An expedition to Mount Nyiragongo, 11,000 feet above sea level - one of a chain of volcanoes in central East Africa. The expedition descends, terrace by terrace, to the lake of lava. Animated diagrams illustrate volcanic activity, then close shots of the lake show the mobility of molten lava, the formation of rocks, the burning of volcanic gases.

results.title: An Everyday miracle
results.brief_description: Shows the use of ultrasound and microphotography to determine intra uterine health from conception to birth. Narrated by Sir David Attenborough, this documentary has incredible shots of the developing foetus.
